info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 5 at 1:22AM EDT until June 5 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Colleton.
* WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers with torrential rainfall extending from just north of Walterboro south to Ritter and Hendersonville. As much as 1 to 3 inches of rain has fallen over the area since just before midnight. An additional 1 to 2 inches could fall through 215 AM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - At 120 AM EDT, an unofficial rain gage along the south side of Walterboro reported 1.76 inches of rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Hendersonville, Ritter, White Hall, Drawdy, Thayer, Colleton Medical Center, Lowcountry Regional Airport, Rhodes Crossroads and Stokes.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
